@graph.caption: square image of bowl of chocolate ganache with whisk

@graph.name: Vegan Chocolate Ganache - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: Learn how to make the most luscious vegan chocolate ganache with just 2 ingredients and 5 minutes! The perfect dessert topping or frosting.

@graph.name: Vegan Chocolate Ganache
@graph.description: Learn how to make the most luscious vegan chocolate ganache with just 2 ingredients and 5 minutes! The perfect dessert topping, frosting, cake filling or truffle filling.
recipeIngredient: 8 ounces vegan chocolate chips or chopped vegan chocolate bars (about 1 cup)
1 cup full fat coconut milk or cream

recipeInstructions.text: Add chocolate chips to a medium sized bowl. If using chocolate bars, chop and place in the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chocolate chips to a medium sized bowl. If using chocolate bars, chop and place in the bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop the thick white part from the can of coconut if it's naturally separated. Try to use mostly the thick white coconut cream, but some of the clearer liquid is fine. A can of coconut cream works best.
recipeInstructions.name: Scoop the thick white part from the can of coconut if it's naturally separated. Try to use mostly the thick white coconut cream, but some of the clearer liquid is fine. A can of coconut cream works best.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the coconut milk in a microwave safe bowl or measuring cup and heat in the microwave for about 1 minute, watching to make sure it doesn’t bubble over.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the coconut milk in a microwave safe bowl or measuring cup and heat in the microwave for about 1 minute, watching to make sure it doesn’t bubble over.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the warm cream over the chocolate chips and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Don't stir yet.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the warm cream over the chocolate chips and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Don't stir yet.

recipeInstructions.text: After 2-3 minutes, whisk the chocolate/melted coconut milk until smooth. To use as a frosting let it cool completely first, it will thicken up and become spreadable. To make it runnier, you can warm it in the microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute before using, such as for pancakes, cupcakes, or as a drizzle on a cake.
recipeInstructions.name: After 2-3 minutes, whisk the chocolate/melted coconut milk until smooth. To use as a frosting let it cool completely first, it will thicken up and become spreadable. To make it runnier, you can warm it in the microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute before using, such as for pancakes, cupcakes, or as a drizzle on a cake.
